plan: In the first five rounds, I'll test the dominant strategy by bidding 50% of my value to establish a baseline. For the next five rounds, I'll explore aggressive strategies by bidding 70% of my value to test profitability when winning more often. In the final five rounds, I'll experiment with conservative strategies by bidding 30% of my value to minimize losses when not winning. Throughout, I'll adjust based on observed patterns in Betty's and Charles's bids, aiming to maximize long-term profit by balancing risk and reward.

In the upcoming rounds, I will test a mix of strategies. Initially, I'll bid 50% of my value to establish a baseline. Then, I'll explore aggressive bids at 70-80% of my value when my value is above $50, aiming to win more often. For values below $50, I'll test conservative bids at 30-40% to minimize losses. I'll also experiment with occasional random bids to gather data on opponents' strategies. I'll adjust based on observed patterns, focusing on maximizing long-term profit by balancing risk and reward.
